Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.machine

Class ThreadCurrentColorMachine

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.machine.ThreadCurrentColorMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ThreadCurrentColorMachine extends Object implements Runnable
Class ThreadCurrentColorMachine

This class represents a separate thread responsible for monitoring and saving the current color of the top card on the table in an UNO game. It periodically checks whether the color of the previously played card differs from the current card and updates the GameUno state accordingly.

If a color change is detected, an optional CurrentColorListener can be notified to handle UI or game logic updates.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadCurrentColorMachine

      public ThreadCurrentColorMachine(GameUno gameUno, Table table)
      Thread responsible for saving the current color of the card. It periodically checks whether the color of the previous and the current cards have changed, and if so it saves it.
      Parameters:
      gameUno - The game currently being played.
      table - The table from the currently played game.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Main execution loop of the thread. Continuously runs while running is true. If the color of the card has changed, the machine waits for a short period before saving it.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • setCurrentColorListener

      public void setCurrentColorListener(CurrentColorListener currentColorListener)
      Sets the listener to be triggered when the color of the cards have changed.
      Parameters:
      currentColorListener - the listener to handle COLOR-related behavior

    • stopThread

      public void stopThread()
      Sets the boolean running false, therefore, ends the run loop
